ResourceHeader.Description: The Norfolk Island Ionosonde station in Norfolk Island, NSW, Australia, has ionosondes since February 1964. They are IPS 4D between 08/1994 and 06/1999, IPS 5A between 07/1993 and 12/1993, CADI between 02/1999 and 05/2007, IPS 5D since 05/2007 to now. The ionosonde information before 07/1993 is not avaiable. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/World_Data_Centre/2/1/19
